member.name: T:Flattiverse.Account
member.summary: An account on the flattiverse-system. This is an offline-object. Therefore the connector will only receive such an object upon query and never update its status-changes. You have to use the ReQuery()-method, if you want to get a new version of this account. You can also query this informations again via connector.QueryAccounts-method.

member.name: F:Flattiverse.Account.ID

member.name: M:Flattiverse.Connector.QueryDesigns
member.summary:
Querys up to 128 designs.
You can edit these designs via the flattiverse.com Homepage.
Beware: The flattiverse-server will queue your and the request of other players to avoid high loads on the database. So this method may need some time in its execution. Parallel requests to this mthod will be declined by the flattiverse-server resulting in an empty list and an exception. You can try some reflection-tricks but you have been warned.

member.name: M:Flattiverse.Connector.QueryAccounts(Flattiverse.QueryStatus)
member.summary:
Querys all accounts in the flattiverse-system. You can pass a QueryStatus object to this method. If you do so it will be filled with status informations about the query. You can process these informations in parallel to show a progressbar for example. If you pass null here, this method won't query the amount of accounts available and therefore is faster.
You can reuse the QueryStatus object, but shouldn't use it in parallel. You shouldn't trust the Total-property in QueryStatus. Maybe a new player registers while you query is active so you can reach more than Total-propertys results.
Beware: The flattiverse-server will queue your and the request of other players to avoid high loads on the database. So this method may need some time in its execution. Parallel requests to this mthod will be declined by the flattiverse-server resulting in an empty list and an exception. You can try some reflection-tricks but you have been warned.
member.param: A StatusQuery object or null, if you don't want status report while querying.

member.summary: Creates a component for the ship-configurator.
member.param: The name of the component. This must be unique.
The description of the component in german.
The description of the component in english.

The avatar encoded as png image including transparency layer with exactly 200x200 pixles. If the image does not contain transparent areas the component won't be created. If all usage- and header-data of the component are bigger than 80 KB in total the component creation will fail with GameException 0x95.

member.name: M:Flattiverse.Connector.QueryComponents(Flattiverse.QueryStatus)
member.summary:
Querys all components in the flattiverse-system. You can pass a QueryStatus object to this method. If you do so it will be filled with status informations about the query. You can process these informations in parallel to show a progressbar for example. If you pass null here, this method won't query the amount of components available and therefore is faster.
You can reuse the QueryStatus object, but shouldn't use it in parallel. You shouldn't trust the Total-property in QueryStatus.
Beware: The flattiverse-server will queue your and the request of other players to avoid high loads on the database. So this method may need some time in its execution. Parallel requests to this mthod will be declined by the flattiverse-server resulting in an empty list and an exception. You can try some reflection-tricks but you have been warned.
member.param: A StatusQuery object or null, if you don't want status report while querying.

member.name: M:Flattiverse.Connector.ToString
member.returns: The connection status as a string.

member.name: M:Flattiverse.Connector.LoadBenchmark(System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Loads a benchmark of your system. Some UniverseGroups may require a report of your benchmark result so that your enemys can see your hardwares performance. This is mostly on team-games or tournaments.
If you execute this function *before* you instantiate the connector, your results will be transmitted to the gameserver and others can see them in Player-class.
You cannot overwrite your current benchmark with this method.

member.name: M:Flattiverse.Connector.SaveBenchmark
member.summary: Saves a previously done benchmark-result. You can save this result in a file and load it in a later session. So you don't have to do this benchmark over and over again.

member.name: M:Flattiverse.Connector.DoBenchmark
member.summary:
Does a small benchmark of your system. Some UniverseGroups may require a report of your benchmark result so that your enemys can see your hardwares performance. This is mostly on team-games or tournaments.
If you execute this function *before* you instantiate the connector, your results will be transmitted to the gameserver and others can see them in Player-class.
You cannot overwrite your current benchmark with this method.

member.name: M:Flattiverse.Controllable.Build(System.String,System.String,System.Single,Flattiverse.CrystalCargoItem[])
member.summary: Builds a new controllable. Your ship must have a builder capable of building the gives class of units to do this. While building, you shouldn't leave your current position (stay within 15 universe-units). To cancel the build, just leave this position or call CancleBuild() on the new unit. This will give you half the build costs back.
member.param: The class (configured with Ship-Designer on homepage) of the unit to build.
The name of the new controllable. Names must be unique.
The direction in degree (0f <= direction < 360f) in which the unit starts.
The crystals to equip the unit with.
member.returns: The new controllable, which will be built. You need to close this unit also.

member.name: M:Flattiverse.Controllable.Tractorbeam(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Engages the tractorbeam of the ship into the given direction, range and with the specified force. The tractorbeam changes the Movement-Vector of other objects toward or away from you. When you affect a Still or Steady Unit your movement gets affected in the opposite way. (See "force".)
member.param: The direction of the tractor-beam in degree.
The range of the tractor-beam in units.
The force of the tractor-beam. Use positive values to move objects to your controllable. Use negative values to push objects away from your controllable.
member.returns: true, if you unit was affected due to the tractor-beam. (Happens when you tractor-beam a Still or Steady Unit.)

member.summary: Sends a binary chatmessage to the player.

member.name: M:Flattiverse.Player.Chat(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Byte[]})
member.summary:
Sends up to 32 binary chatmessages to the player. This method guarantees the order of the messages and sends them parallel without opening additional threads. This method opens as many parallel requests as you send messages in the flattiverse-protocol. The flattiverse-protocol in this version is limited to 255 parallel requests, so if you execute more than 255 parallel requests some requests will fail with GameException 0x11: Too many sessions active in protocol. Each message uses its own slot and so does Scan(), Move(), etc.
If you execute this method eight times in parallel with a full set of 32 messages you will get this error. You have been warned.
member.param: The List of messages to send. This list will get altered and should not be used in your code anymore.

member.name: M:Flattiverse.Universe.QueryUnits(Flattiverse.QueryStatus)
member.summary:
Querys all database-units in the universe. You can pass a QueryStatus object to this method. If you do so it will be filled with status informations about the query. You can process these informations in parallel to show a progressbar for example. If you pass null here, this method won't query the amount of accounts available and therefore is faster.
You can reuse the QueryStatus object, but shouldn't use it in parallel. You shouldn't trust the Total-property in QueryStatus. Maybe a new player registers while you query is active so you can reach more than Total-propertys results.
Beware: The flattiverse-server will queue your and the request of other players to avoid high loads on the database. So this method may need some time in its execution. Parallel requests to this mthod will be declined by the flattiverse-server resulting in an empty list and an exception. You can try some reflection-tricks but you have been warned.
member.param: A StatusQuery object or null, if you don't want status report while querying.

member.name: M:Flattiverse.Universe.CreateUnit(System.String,Flattiverse.UnitKind,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,Flattiverse.Team,System.Byte[],System.Collections.Generic.List{Flattiverse.RAWOrbiting})
member.summary: Creates an unit in the universe. You just can create units which are implementing IDatabaseUnit on the server. This means you can't create player units and so on.
member.param: The name of the unit. This can't be the name of a ship which is online in any universe of this UniverseGroup or the name of unit which does already exist in this universe.
The kind of the unit. This can only be one of these: Sun; Planet; Moon; Meteoroid; Buoy; Asteroid; BlackHole; WormHole; MissionTarget; SpaceJellyFish; Switch; Gate; Spawner or Nebula.
The absolute x coordinate of the unit.
The absolute y coordinate of the unit.
The team of the unit or null if the created unit shall not have a team.
The data-block of the unit. Some units don't have additional datas, others have a special set of binary datas.
The orbiting informations. null or an empty list if there shall be no orbiting.

member.name: M:Flattiverse.Universe.QueryLocations(Flattiverse.QueryStatus)
member.summary:
Querys all location in the universe. You can pass a QueryStatus object to this method. If you do so it will be filled with status informations about the query. You can process these informations in parallel to show a progressbar for example. If you pass null here, this method won't query the amount of accounts available and therefore is faster.
You can reuse the QueryStatus object, but shouldn't use it in parallel. You shouldn't trust the Total-property in QueryStatus. Maybe a new location is added while your query is active so you can reach more than Total-propertys results.
Beware: The flattiverse-server will queue your and the request of other players to avoid high loads on the database. So this method may need some time in its execution. Parallel requests to this mthod will be declined by the flattiverse-server resulting in an empty list and an exception. You can try some reflection-tricks but you have been warned.
member.param: A StatusQuery object or null, if you don't want status report while querying.

member.param: The name of the GameLocation. This can be null to not specify any name.
The left border of the region.
The top border of the region.
The right border of the region.
The bottom border of the region.
The team or null if the region should be for everyone.
True, if this should be a start-location. Start-locations usa a round-robin-mode.
